translated: Preface to the Initial Approach to the Stages of the Dharma Realm Preface to the Initial Approach to the Stages of the Dharma Realm
Åšramaá¹‡a Zhiyi of Xiuchan Temple on Mount Tiantai has compiled
the Initial Approach to the Stages of the Dharma Realm in three encyclopedias, totaling seven scrolls, to circulate among beginners.
It is roughly divided into three meanings.
First, for those who read sÅ«tras and study treatises, whenever they encounter a Dharma gate,
if they are confused by the names and numbers,
second, for those who do not understand the sequence of the shallow and deep Dharma gates established by the holy teachings,
third, for those who study the three contemplations,
they should use the names, characteristics, meanings, and principles of these dharmas,
to experience and transform them one by one in the mind,
then the understanding of contemplation will be unobstructed,
and one will not be confused when encountering circumstances.
If in a single thought,
one penetrates all the Buddha Dharma,
then the three contemplations will naturally be clearly understood.
Therefore, these three encyclopedias are produced,
with the names and teachings corresponding.
Under each name, the essence and characteristics are briefly distinguished.
I have only obtained three scrolls.
